snippet: France on Tuesday became the first Western country to recognize the coalition, seeking to inject momentum into a broad effort to build a viable and effective opposition that would hasten the end of a stalemated civil war.
abstract: France announces it is recognizing the newly formed Syrian rebel coalition and will consider arming the group, seeking to inject momentum into a broad effort to build a viable and effective opposition that would hasten the end of a stalemated civil war that has destabilized the Middle East; France is the first Western country to fully embrace the coalition, which came together under Western pressure after days of difficult negotiations.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Neil MacFarquhar and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; and Richard Berry from Paris.

lead_paragraph: France on Tuesday became the first Western country to recognize the coalition, seeking to inject momentum into a broad effort to build a viable and effective opposition that would hasten the end of a stalemated civil war.

headline.main: France Grants Its Recognition to Syria Rebels
headline.print_headline: France Grants Its Recognition To Syria Rebels
